question: [File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/config.rs] [Functions: create() + create_filestore()] [API Inconsistency] Can mixing synchronous create() and async create_filestore() methods cause race conditions or inconsistent file store states when both are used on the same config? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/config.rs] [Functions: create() + create_filestore()] [Version Mismatch] Do the v1 (FileStoreOperator) and v2 (IFileStore) implementations have security fixes in one but not the other, creating vulnerabilities when using create() instead of create_filestore()? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/config.rs] [Structs: GcsFileStore + LocalFileStore] [Privilege Escalation] Can an attacker switch from LocalFileStore to GcsFileStore configuration to gain access to cloud resources they shouldn't have access to? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/config.rs] [Structs: GcsFileStore + LocalFileStore] [Configuration Confusion] Can ambiguous configuration files be interpreted as both GcsFileStore and LocalFileStore, causing undefined behavior in file store initialization? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/config.rs] [Derive: Deserialize] [Malformed Input] Can malformed JSON/YAML trigger panics or undefined behavior during IndexerGrpcFileStoreConfig deserialization, causing indexer crashes? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/config.rs] [Derive: Deserialize] [Integer Overflow] Can numeric fields in the configuration (if any are added) overflow during deserialization, causing arithmetic errors in file store operations? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/config.rs] [Derive: Deserialize] [Denial of Service] Can deeply nested JSON structures or extremely long strings in configuration cause stack overflow or memory exhaustion during deserialization? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/config.rs] [Derive: Deserialize] [Unicode Handling] Can malicious Unicode sequences in bucket names or paths bypass validation checks after deserialization, causing security vulnerabilities? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/config.rs] [Derive: Deserialize] [Default Field Injection] Can the #[serde(default)] attribute on enable_compression be exploited to inject unexpected default values if not present in config? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/config.rs] [Derive: Deserialize] [Extra Fields] Does serde allow unknown fields in the configuration that could be used for configuration injection attacks or to bypass validation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/config.rs] [Derive: Serialize] [Sensitive Data Leakage] Can serializing IndexerGrpcFileStoreConfig expose GCS service account key paths or other sensitive configuration in logs or error messages? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/config.rs] [Derive: Clone] [Credential Duplication] Does Clone implementation create multiple copies of sensitive GCS credentials in memory, increasing the attack surface for memory extraction attacks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/config.rs] [Derive: Debug] [Information Disclosure] Does Debug formatting output service account key paths or bucket names that could aid attackers in reconnaissance or credential theft? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/config.rs] [Derive: Debug] [Logging Exposure] Are IndexerGrpcFileStoreConfig instances logged with Debug formatting, potentially exposing sensitive configuration to log aggregation systems? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/config.rs] [Field: enable_compression] [Decompression Bomb] Can enable_compression be used to trigger zip bomb attacks where small compressed files expand to massive sizes, causing resource exhaustion? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/config.rs] [Field: enable_compression] [Algorithm Selection] Does the implementation validate which compression algorithm is used, or can an attacker force use of insecure or vulnerable compression formats? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/config.rs] [Field: enable_compression] [Side Channel] Can compression ratio analysis leak information about the contents of indexer files, potentially revealing sensitive transaction patterns? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/config.rs] [Field: enable_compression] [Performance Attack] Can toggling enable_compression cause inconsistent file formats between different indexer instances, leading to compatibility issues or data corruption? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/config.rs] [Type: PathBuf] [Platform Differences] Can PathBuf interpretation differ between Windows and Unix systems, causing path traversal vulnerabilities on one platform but not the other? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/config.rs] [Type: PathBuf] [UTF-8 Validation] Does PathBuf properly validate UTF-8 encoding, or can non-UTF-8 paths cause unexpected behavior in file operations? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/config.rs] [Type: PathBuf] [Canonicalization] Are PathBuf instances canonicalized before use to resolve symlinks and relative paths, preventing directory traversal attacks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/config.rs] [Type: PathBuf] [Length Limits] Can excessively long paths in PathBuf cause buffer overflows or truncation in underlying filesystem operations? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/config.rs] [Field: gcs_file_store_bucket_sub_dir] [None Handling] Is None value for bucket_sub_dir properly handled in GCS operations, or can it cause null pointer dereferences or unexpected root bucket access? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/config.rs] [Field: gcs_file_store_bucket_sub_dir] [Empty Path] Can an empty PathBuf or single-character path bypass directory restrictions in GCS file store operations? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/config.rs] [Field: gcs_file_store_bucket_sub_dir] [Injection Attack] Can special GCS path characters in bucket_sub_dir be used for path injection or to escape subdirectory restrictions? (High)
